instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_ON_OFF: What is SMC_ON_OFF? SMC_ONOFF tells the computer that the power button has been pressed..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short with battery
threads.message:
green light and turn on(reset at the loading) without battery.
when connected battery green light goes off and not turn on.
changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> but the same.
ppbus 19.5 with battery 10.8
any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short with battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short with battery
threads.message:
replaced both...still the same..
when battery connected and connect the charger the is green light for 1sec then turn off and the fan spin for 3-4sec.
when just battery connected <SIGNAL>SMC_ON_OFF</SIGNAL> cant turn in on.
and with just the charger there is green and orange light and it turn on but dont pass the loading.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short with battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short with battery
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> should be 12.6V without battery, not 19.5V. If it is 19.5V then <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is always passing current between drain and source. Make sure it is not shorted and make sure its gate has good continuity to <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short with battery
threads.message: o.k i was replace again now <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 6-7v with just charger..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short with battery
threads.message:
Check all traces and solders around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Post its basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Just in case, replace <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR>.
